{"step_by_step_thinking": "The complaint of sticking of food in the interproximal area suggests that there is a problem with the contact area between the teeth. The disto-oclusal amalgam restoration in tooth 47 indicates that the restoration is located on the distal (back) side of the tooth. The most common reason for food sticking in the interproximal area in this case would be a contact area that is too occlusively positioned, meaning it is too high or towards the biting surface of the tooth.", "answer_choice": "C"}
